topic: Vision-Language Model Research

  entities:

    Vision Language Models|Model

  proposition: Tony Lee, Haoqin Tu, Chi Heem Wong, Wenhao Zheng, Yiyang Zhou, Yifan Mai, Josselin Somerville Roberts, Michihiro Yasunaga, Huaxiu Yao, and Cihang Xie published a paper titled "VHELM: A Holistic Evaluation of Vision Language Models" on arXiv in 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    VHELM|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    VHELM|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    VHELM|DESCRIBED_BY|Holistic Evaluation of Vision Language Models

    entity-entity relationships:
    Tony Lee|AUTHOR_OF|VHELM
    Haoqin Tu|AUTHOR_OF|VHELM

    Wenhao Zheng|AUTHOR_OF|VHELM

    Michihiro Yasunaga|AUTHOR_OF|VHELM
    Huaxiu Yao|AUTHOR_OF|VHELM
    Cihang Xie|AUTHOR_OF|VHELM

  proposition: Dong Lu, Tianyu Pang, Chao Du, Qian Liu, Xianjun Yang, and Min Lin published a paper on "Test-time backdoor attacks on multimodal large language models" on arXiv in 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Research Paper|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    Research Paper|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Research Paper|DESCRIBED_BY|Test-time backdoor attacks on multimodal large language models

    entity-entity relationships:
    Dong Lu|AUTHOR_OF|Research Paper

  proposition: Multiple research papers explore the adversarial robustness and evaluation of vision-language models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Research Papers|RESEARCH_FOCUS|Adversarial Robustness
    Research Papers|RESEARCH_FOCUS|Vision-Language Model Evaluation

    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Researchers are investigating various aspects of robustness, including adversarial attacks, prompt tuning, and model evaluation methodologies.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Researchers|INVESTIGATING|Robustness
    Researchers|INVESTIGATING|Adversarial Attacks
    Researchers|INVESTIGATING|Prompt Tuning
    Researchers|INVESTIGATING|Model Evaluation Methodologies

    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Key research areas include understanding and mitigating vulnerabilities in large multimodal models.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Research Areas|FOCUS|Understanding Vulnerabilities
    Research Areas|FOCUS|Mitigating Vulnerabilities
    Research Areas|MODEL_TYPE|Large Multimodal Models

    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: Evaluation techniques range from holistic assessments to specific robustness benchmarks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Evaluation Techniques|TYPE|Holistic Assessments
    Evaluation Techniques|TYPE|Robustness Benchmarks

    entity-entity relationships:
    None

  proposition: The research spans topics such as zero-shot adversarial robustness, frequency-domain prompting, and adversarial prompt tuning.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Research|TOPIC|Zero-Shot Adversarial Robustness
    Research|TOPIC|Frequency-Domain Prompting
    Research|TOPIC|Adversarial Prompt Tuning

    entity-entity relationships:
    None
